hello everybody
I changed some of zulip's front-end pages.
And then I'm going to regenerate the tarball.
Problems:
The tarball cannot be installed in a production environment.
I did not modify other web files.
This is what happens.
Error: ( pasted_image.png
Compare my tarball and zulip's tarball.
On the left is the file on the right of my unpressed tarball and on the right is the tarbal file of zulip. pasted_image-1.png
Installation-errors.txt

@吕阿萨 when you make changes, you should make them in a Zulip development environment and either push a Git branch (and use upgrade-zulip-from-git) or use tools/build-release-tarball to build a proper release-like tarball.
Editing the requirements.txt in-place in a production environment is not something we support, and the things we do support and really clean, so you should just do it the documented way.

That's not the case
I did not edit the requirements. TXT in the production environment.
I was making the changes and then directly I took the source code tarball, which resulted in such a result.

@Tim Abbott
But we didn't build the git branch.
The problem is not going to be here？
@吕阿萨 read http://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/production/maintain-secure-upgrade.html#upgrading for how to do this; if you follow our recommended procedure, you'll be fine.
